byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and THOMAS KAPLAN

abstract: Sen Tim Kaine's use of death penalty while governor of Virginia may prove problematic issue for him as Hillary Clinton's vice presidential running mate; Kaine personally opposes capital punishment but says he was sworn to uphold law while in office, illustrating his conflicting positions as both politician and man of conviction.
lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton’s running mate fervently opposed capital punishment, but carried it out 11 times as governor of Virginia, while granting clemency only once.

headline.main: On Death Penalty Cases, Tim Kaine Revealed Inner Conflict
headline.print_headline: Foe of Death Penalty, Kaine Carried It Out as a Governor

snippet: Hillary Clinton’s running mate fervently opposed capital punishment, but carried it out 11 times as governor of Virginia, while granting clemency only once....
